title: Mordekaiser changes?! /hopeful
body:
I noticed in the patch notes Riot said they were working on changes to Mordekaiser (because of or at least in the section referring to DFG removal).

Anyone have any thoughts on what they may do? Morde is/was my favorite champion, but I so rarely play him lately because as a mid/top he gets pretty harshly out-shined.

replies.body: One of the options we're looking at at the moment is whether we should play up Morde's tankier side a bit more. Huge guy in a full suit of armor with a passive that generates a shield suggest tough front line dude. The removal of DFG already shifts him away from bursting down a target almost instantly, our thinking is that offering him a more sustained presence might be a good approach as a result. That's very much an idea being explored right now though, not yet a proven direction.

First thing I would do is change the whole "shield is always decaying" to "shield decays while out of combat". Because you are always losing shield even while fighting, you never get that much mileage out of it.

Would this be a good direction or lead to obnoxious "can't be killed" scenarios?

>Would this be a good direction or lead to obnoxious "can't be killed" scenarios?

Obnoxious can't be killed scenarios might actually be a good direction. He doesn't have the mobility, CC or burst to earn his keep in any other way. Being extremely hard to kill is something unique he could bring.

It would remove "stall until his shield is weaker" and also buff his laning by making his shield close to permanent. There needs to be some moment of weakness for him to be healthy, in one way or other. Maybe it could build up and give him a decaying shield when it hit max? idk

I think you could have something like "Each time an enemy champion damages Morde, his shield stops decaying for 1.5 seconds. Additional damage refreshes the duration of the shield (but does not lengthen it)," without creating unhealthy gameplay.

The problem with mord tho, is that all he offers to his team is dmg. He can't kite, he has no form of cc, and hard cc shuts him down hard.

So if you just make mord tankier and he does the same/less dmg than he does now, ppl can just ignore him. But if he does a ton of dmg and can't be killed, you have the troll king from season 2 all over again.
I'm not sure that's true. I think if morde went liandrylai, he'd deal out some pretty significant AOE dps in a teamfight.

Not really true.

People say stuff like that all the time, but time and time again we are proved wrong.

If morde was to keep his current numbers, and simply got a bit tankier, ignoring him would be very foolish, but at the same time, he would not be able to instagib anymore. He is walking AOE damage, he has no cc, so him doing lots of damage, and staying alive as long as he is doing damage is how he needs to be. That is mordekaiser.

Now before you get scared and say that is broken, keep in mind that he has NO mobility or cc. Literally none. He may be the easiest champion in the game to gank at early levels, due to him also pushing the wave innately.

The reason morde was bs in the past was because of dfg. Now, I think he can have lots of damage AND lots of tank, because he is VERY easy to shut down, and even easier to focus and blow up.

See, heres the thing about front line guys that deal damage over a period of longer time, since your moving morde away from "bursting one person down"

they all have some inherent type of CC that allows them to keep there damage applied on a target.   More has none of that, people can just walk away from his damage and half of his damage is when he is in melee range

I am against this change. morde is one of my favorite champions and one of my most played. i dont think going the direction of tank is that great of an idea because he lacks the mobility or cc to initiate or kite for a carry. he also gains a shield based on his damage dealt which would make the shield useless later into the game without sufficient damage items (while i agree that building damage to become more tank is a bad play pattern) it makes him feel lack luster to play him as a tank.

Please!!! Mordekaiser should be all about diving into the middle of the enemy team and hitting as many as he can with his AoE heavy skills over a longer duration.

I personally would like a "drain life" type ult like we currently have, but perhaps an AoE like:

 R - Suffering - Mordekaiser begins to absorb the life force of nearby enemy champions. The current power of this effect is reduced by 20% for each additional champion. (Multiplicitive. So 40%ish strength per target at 5 champions.) Mordekaiser heals for X% of damage done this way.

This keeps him in check in lane, but encourages him to spread the suffering in a team fight. :D

While your idea is cool, Morde's ult is way too fun and useful to revamp. Keep it as it is! And since {{item:3145}} is mandatory on Morde, his ult already restores a significant portion of your health.

> [{quoted}](name=EfficientDynamo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8qkcROAR,comment-id=000000100000,timestamp=2015-01-30T01:05:59.284+0000)
>
> While your idea is cool, Morde's ult is way too fun and useful to revamp. Keep it as it is! And since {{item:3145}} is mandatory on Morde, his ult already restores a significant portion of your health.

The problem is that it's TOO useful. Especially if you managed to grab the hyper farmed Marksman. It's really feast or famine in that it either works and your damage suddenly doubles, or you fail to kill your target and it's useless.

If Riot instead focused on the sustain part, which is NEVER why it's used right now, they could put all that now free power budget back to the rest of his kit.

My thought was that the power of his ult is naturally limited by his ability to get close to the ADC. Morde is slow and easily kited by most ADC's, so even if he gets his ult on them he will take a lot of damage and will likely have problems finishing the ADC off.

I agree that Morde could use some sustain. I may be wrong, but I think almost every other character with health costs on abilities has a way of gaining it back (Mundo passive, Vlad Q, Aatrox W, etc.). Arguably Morde should get the same, as its a missing part of his power budget. Maybe if he overcharges his shield he gains a % of the shield health points he would have gotten? I personally prefer the idea I stated elsewhere in this thread of a maxed shield triggering a slow field, but this idea could work too.

His ult is SUPPOSED to be how he gets his HP back. But everyone instead focused on DFG->Ult-> ADC pet part of it.
Mordekaiser looks like a badass dude in a metal suit. I honestly think he should become a fighter.

In this direction wouldn't add a tenacity buff based on % of his shield be a good thing to add?

Since Morde has no CC (while commonlya ccpeted tanks have at least 1 hard CC) would go in the direction of giving him more soft tankyness + soft CC or rather an "Unstoppable death advance" feel? (Personally I'd go for the second one, no champion has that feel and it fits Mordekaiser theme pretty well)

Hi! I interacted many times with the community in order to find subtle but satisfying changes to Morde, your time is valuable so to keep short here some links below.

TL;DR
- His Q is good as it is now and is really liked that way, but some QoL about knowing better if you land full damage or aoe would be really appreciated, maybe reusing Isolation from Kha
- His low teamfight utility if he falls behind: one proposed solution that encountred much favor was adding utility to E, ( conic spell damage) even at the price of a bit of damage, so it feels less oppressing in lane and more useful in tf. In proposed links i suggested magis res shred, but it can be everything is deemed right.
- MOSTLY, a way to deal with movement. There was a bit of split, but the majority i encountred expressed that movement speed boosts, dashes, slows and CC are NOT for Mordekaiser; in many, me too, think that sole tenacity/slow reduction is way more fitting on him, probably on a self cast W.

Gameplay post

updating with a wee more links
Morde and dfg

A bit of lore context
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/TxFBwJMK-tematics-and-lore-discussion-mordekaiser

Reducing the Creeping Death's cooldown and increasing its bonus stats, even if it can only be used on himself would be enought to achieve the Tank/Bruiser role. But he needs some kind of CC to work as a tank. Increasing slow in Q maybe? Something like 10/20/30/40/50(5/10/15/20/25 to secondary targets)?

I'm certainly not an expert on balance, but I think it would be interesting to make Mordekaiser's scale based on Armor and Magic Resist. It would make sense thematically considering that he is literally made of armor, plus it would compliment the secondary health that the shield grants.


Maybe give him bonus health regeneration and tenacity that scales based on how much his shield is charged.

Finally, Activating Mace of Spades gives a slight MS boost when moving toward an enemy champion, and when it hits, it applies a debuff that slows the target when they are moving away from Mordekaiser and increases in effectiveness based on how much Mordekaiser's shield is charged.

Again, I'm not an expert on balancing, but I think that some of these changes could be interesting.

Let's look at it this way: Morde has absolutely no mobility and no form of CC. That puts him way behind the vast majority of other champs right out of the starting gate. Those two things are huge in League, and not having either one is a significant drawback. With DFG, Morde could kinda sorta maybe circumvent this by surprising and blowing up an opponent. Since he can no longer do that, he seems like he's got almost nothing going for him except a badass look.

So aside from giving him mobility, or CC, or a DFG-like ability similar to what {{champion:105}} got on his ult, increased tankiness is about the only thing left for the poor bastard. Of course, this runs the risk of Morde becoming the mid lane version of {{champion:83}}: sustain all day and bore your opponent to death.

Bottom line, the master of metal and death is going to need something to fill the gap DFG left behind. I'd love to see some kind of enhancement to his auto attacks personally (it is a giant mace after all).

>Huge guy

Well in game he's not huge at all.

It sounds to me you almost want to make him a tank. You better realize that is the exact opposite of what he is right now. He's an melee carry mage who is famously known for lack of both movement- and cc abilities. Once he has some levels, he can clear a minion waves extremely fast and that is one of he's core strengths. (that used to mean a lot more)

I remember a rioter writing that you wouldn't turn Shen into a damage dealer because that's not the way he is known, despite being a ninja, so why would Mordekaiser be a tank?

He's almost furthest from tank there is. He doesn't initiate, he's very weak when behind and carries hard when ahead.

Even for the DFG part I wonder. Have you taken an objective look of what people who play him successfully build before and after it's removal, how it affected their success? It was probably decent, but a lot people, myself included, never even built it. People **who don't play him keep thinking it was he's only item**, but actually DFG worked a lot better on ranged assassins with cc, such as LeBlanc, Ahri, Syndra, Veigar. I can't believe you don't seem to acknowledge that.

I'm not here just to bash you, but I do feel like rioters often get a lot wrong when you talk about Mordekaiser. And really, a lot of your community seems to feel very similarly and are generally disappointed by it.

One thing you could do right now is fix some of the bugs he has.  He has tons of them.

As a Modekaiser player who tended to play him as a bruiser, rather than a 100-0 burster, and only occasionally bought DFG, I'm looking forward to changes to make his durability and extended team fight prowess better.
It would certainly make more sense for him to be a tankier champion.

And if you want CC but don't want to change his kit, you could give him a slow aura when his shield is full. This would only occur for a second or so as you take damage/it decays, but would be enough to allow him to stick to people without overloading him.

Honestly, while reinforcing the "fantasy" of being a living suit of armor would be nice, it would equally be good to reinforce the mage aspect of the character.

Then again, having more options with spell vamp would be just as nice.  :)

Then W should become more interactive and rely more on tankiness or on damage depending if you are using it on yourself (more tankiness) or on an ally(more damage), and his Q should get at least a bit of a soft CC(small amount of slow on first enemy hit, amplified when W is active and the enemy is in its range)

I doubt this will be seen BUT I would like you to consider looking more at mobility than reworking his abilities all together. As it stands, Mordekaiser works well as an AP Bruiser in the top lane save for his lack of mobility. I've found that he can lane similarly to the likes of Lissandra and Cassiopeia in that he can harass as he farms and exploit missteps by the enemy Top Lane. What he LACKS in comparison to such champions, though, is mobility in his kit. As such I only pick him in team compositions that can supplement that lack of mobility (i.e. If I have champions such as Thresh, Lulu, Orianna, Jayce, etc).

I'll also usually only pick him in team comps that have the potential to quickly kill a champion (usually the enemy AD Carry) marked with his ultimate. But back to his mobility issues...

**Ideally** (at least as a starting point) he probably only needs a Rage/Furor Passive on Mace of Spades that starts as a nice boost of speed then diminishes over a short-ish duration of time.

From this point there are two other abilities in his kit that could be used to provide mobility - Creeping Death and Children of the Grave. These would provide movement speed for Mordekaiser for that duration of the abilities (in the case of Creeping Death, it would only provide Movement speed for Mordekaiser and only if he casts it on himself).

Here's a mock-up of these abilities:
**Mace of Spades (Q):** On next hit, Mordekaiser swings his mace with such force that it echoes out, striking up to 3 additional nearby targets, dealing 80/110/140/170/200 (+100% bonus Attack Damage) (+40% Ability Power) Magic Damage. If the target is alone, 132/181.5/231/280.5/330 (+165% bonus Attack Damage) (+66% Ability Power) magic damage is dealt instead. *Mordekaiser also gains 40/50/60/70/80 Movement speed that diminishes over 5 seconds.*
**Creeping Death (W):** Unleashes a protective cloud of metal shards to surround an ally for 6 seconds, increasing their Armor and Magic Resistance by 10/15/20/25/30 and dealing 24/38/52/66/80 (+20% Ability Power) Magic Damage per second to nearby enemies. *If Mordekaiser casts Creeping Death on himself he gains 3/6/9/12/15% Movement Speed for the duration of the ability.*
**Children of the Grave (R):** Steals 24/29/34 (+4% Ability Power)% of target champion's maximum Health (half stolen initially and half over 10 seconds; deals Magic Damage).If the target dies while cursed, their soul is enslaved and will follow Mordekaiser as a ghost for 30 seconds. Mordekaiser gains 20% of their Ability Power and Attack Damage, and the ghost's stats are enhanced. *For 5 seconds when Children of the Grave is cast, Mordekaiser gains 50/100/150 Movement Speed and for 5 seconds after that the bonus becomes 25/50/75.*

It would also be really great if his abilities had shorter/no cast time.

I've always been more of a fan of Morde as an AP bruiser rather than an anti-assassin burst mage. I'd like to see his shield toned back early on though. Playing as Morde, laning always feels like I'm mindlessly casting my rotation on cooldown, and playing against is boring and irritating.

Jesus Christ a red post that's actually a designer. 

If we're looking to make Morde more durable he seriously needs to keep his shield. Shit is supposed to be metal armor not ice cream in the summer.

Morde is never going to get cc guys.

He is unique because he is the only champion in the game because he has no cc or mobility enhancment in his kit.

Riot said they would be trying to add some tankiness to him this next patch. Check surrender at 20.

They gave no specifics, but because he cannot instagib anymore without dfg, they want him to be tankier in fights, so that he can do his job, which is to deal as much damage as possible, and to stay alive by vamping off of enemies.

Personally the fantasy I imagine when playing mordekaiser is basically the exact same scene as Sauron in the beginning of the Fellowship of the Rings where I just walk up to the biggest heroes/leaders of all the other races and just thrash them around with a giant ass mace like theyre nothing.

When Im actually playing him though, I feel like a complete opportunistic coward since there is almost zero chance to quickly generate shields for a team fight so I cant just get in range and start doing damage since without my shield, if i walk in ill just get stunned or slowed and then picked apart, rather quickly might I add. Instead I have to just wait around and then burst the enemy carry and then rely on the ghost to generate the shields to keep me alive as well as do damage. However, it does feel pretty sweet clearing minion ways so easily

Seeing as Riot nowadays wants skills with counterplay and interaction for the opposing team, even though Mordekaiser's current ult is pretty darn cool it definitely needs to go. In keep with the theme of him controlling the dead and their spirits though, perhaps his new ult should be him releasing a number of spirits (determined by the number of minions he has farmed, kinda like Nasus' Q but defensively) that surround him kinda like the Necromancer's bone armor skill in Diablo 2. These spirits block incoming projectiles (both horizontal and vertical) and traps, potentially negating CC

This would facilitate his ability to do damage at close range and charge his shield to become tanky at the same time by giving him a gap closer of sorts where instead of him having increased mobility all of a sudden, he is not affected by mobility inhibitors or damage. With this mordekaiser would have a window of immense power when his ult is available but when it is not his opponents can still resort to staying outside his range and CC him so he can't do damage to generate shields.


TL:DR Change morde's ult into a a swirling shield comprised of the ghosts of minions he's killed that protects him to allow him to becoming an immobile, CC-less mage that gets tanky when doing tons of damage at close range

My main Question about Mordekaiser is, what is his shield for? It's as if it serves no other purpose than to act as Temp HP.

One thing I would like to consider is adding some Mechanic to actually stacking your shield, giving him a bit more power while in the thicket of combat. 

Someone suggested a slow aura when the shield is full. The problem with this is that it takes one spell or auto to negate the slow. Perhaps a passive aura that scales with shield strength. 

I think the Direction was more towards Bruiser than tank. So Probably not as much CC but good trading and lane sustain.

Hi everyone out there, I hope those of you who love Mordekaiser, and enjoy playing him read this.

I'd just like to say that my favorite line of our beloved murder emperor is, "I shall bring great suffering". He may only say it once when you pick him, but I always find it his most iconic line. I just want people to remember that he is pains paladin, and making Morde a tank doesn't really fit with his whole theme. Sure he's a big suit of armor, but just his lore and kit don't suit the idea of a tank, but rather a fighter or some kind of battle mage.

At the end of the day though, what ever the changes may be, I'll just accept them and learn to play Morde a new way, I just hope that he doesn't stray to far away from what he is right now.

{{champion:82}} When there's a will, there's always a hue.

I've always loved morde as a Lich King (more magically oriented).

Right now other then his look he is lacking in the frontline armored guy(wraight?)  departement. (He does have a "magical" shield but so does annie :))

For previous champion reworks like Sion it was a healthy change to choose between either AP or Fighter aspect and stick with one. It makes it easier to give those champions a healthy gameplay and make them up to par with the other current champions.

In this particular case I however would not do this and try to explain how you could achieve this :)

Like mentioned in a post below our beloved mordekaiser has on first glance a lot in common with the Lich King and even more to Sauron.

Suggested changes :

W : becomes now a sweeping attack with his mace, from right to left with a small knockback that stuns his enemies for 0.5secs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BhjDnrw34QA watch at 3:30 for the mentioned attack.

Q : make his Q a linear skillshot where he throws his mace to his enemies, staggering them for a short time slowing them for 40/45/50/55/60 %
reactivating his Q would summon his mace after a short while back to his hand (StarWars style where you summon your weapon back to your hand or even similar to Oriana) the move back could have a unique ability affecting all units is comes across on the way back.

These 2 changes are core changes I think (they don't have to be exactly like I mentioned abilities and effects could be different, I'm not a very creative person :D)

The **GOAL** of these 2 changes :

1. make tank/fighter Mordekaiser a possibility (without any form of cc there is no purpose for him to become a frontline)
2. giving him a way to initiate a fight (another very valuable tool for a frontline, not needed but highly appreciated)
3. A skill shot to separate the good from the great mordekaiser's (raising his skill cap a bit can't hurt ;))
4. merging the "huge metal dude" aspect with the Wraight/ Mage not only visually but also in his gameplay.

R is pretty fine to me and a unique and pretty much core aspect that defines current Morde so I wouldn't change anything here.

W : could use so changes but probably more on a visual side where there are weapons / undead creatures (previously slain foes ?) that whirl around him and act like a shield blocking projectiles ? The only problem I see with this is the readability of the move might make it look chaotique in team fights and I guess from a developer side it might take up to much resources making a skill like this ?

PS : my body is still ready : http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/attachment.php?attachmentid=80276&d=1333011362

Imo, either his Q or E should slow, or stun enemies.

Or you could have the option to use ur shield on enemies, slowing and dealing damage over time to them.

I love mordekaiser, he is my favorite champion and I love the idea of playing up his tankier side. I am particularly a fan of bruiser morde vs the glass cannon morde that is more common. If you decide to pursue a direction on morde, I suggest that you play up his tanky, sustained damage aspect.
Complete with a huehuehuehue laugh when you spam ctrl 4 pls rito {{summoner:30}}

one interesting mechanic would be increasing his health-costs by a lot but letting him regain health by hitting champions. that would gate him from keeping his shield up indefinitely from minions by requiring him to get in and hit a champion occasionally. the range on E would probably make regaining health too easy so this would either be for auto-attack-range or with E's downtime being higher.
Any kind of CC buff is deeply appreciated. To me, his damage is alright even without Deathfire Grasp.
